preqs: Students must have passed two units from the following: ECB1101 or ECG1101 or ECS1101 or ECW1101 and ECB2331 or ECG2730 or ECS2730 or ECW2730 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {10, 20, 41, 50}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB3143, ECF3143, ECG3143, ECS3143}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ECB1101, ECB2331, ECB2730, ECG1101, ECG2730, ECP1100, ECS1101, ECS2730, ECW1101, ECW2730} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Unit was previously coded {3393, ECG3143%, ECW3143%, GBU3109}

description: This unit is designed to analyse the effect of money on key economic variables such as interest rates, inflation, output, and on the workings of the banking sector. In addition, the unit examines the roles played by Commercial Banks and the Central Bank in the process of money creation and the implementation of monetary policy. The unit uses an economic approach to allow analysis of policy decisions.
